options.None: have no graph in the viewport
options.Dropdown Menu: File -> Open File: lay out a network graph from the Excel, SIF, or GraphML network if there are no errors in the file
options.Dropdown Menu: Demo -> Demo #1: lay out an unweighted network graph from Demo #1
options.Dropdown Menu: Demo -> Demo #2: lay out a weighted network graph from Demo #2
options.Dropdown Menu: Demo -> Demo #3: lay out an unweighted network graph from Demo #3
options.Dropdown Menu: Demo -> Demo #4: lay out a weighted network graph from Demo #4

options.Select: center, zoom to 100%, and reapply the force graph parameters

options.Select \"To Unweighted SIF\": export an unweighted SIF file from the graph currently loaded
options.Select \"To Weighted SIF\": export a weighted SIF file from the graph currently loaded
options.Select \"To Unweighted GraphML\": export an unweighted GraphML file from the graph currently loaded
options.Select \"To Weighted GraphML\": export a weighted GraphML file from the graph currently loaded

title: Sidebar Menu: Force Graph Parameter Sliders

options.Keep at Default Values: The graph should be laid out according to the default values of the force graph parameter sliders
options.Decrease Link Distance: The graph's edges should visibly decrease in length if Lock Force Graph Parameters is unchecked
options.Increase Link Distance: The graph's edges should visibly increase in length if Lock Force Graph Parameters is unchecked
options.Increase Charge: The graph's nodes should visibly increase attraction to each other if Lock Force Graph Parameters is unchecked
options.Decrease Charge: The graph's nodes should visibly decrease attraction to each other if Lock Force Graph Parameters is unchecked

title: Sidebar Menu: Lock Force Graph Parameters Checkbox
text: The Force Graph Parameter sliders should

title: Sidebar Menu: Reset Force Graph Parameters Button
text: The Force Graph Parameter sliders should

options.Click: revert to the default values, if Lock Force Graph Parameters is unchecked.

title: Sidebar Menu: Undo Reset Button
text: The Force Graph Parameter sliders should

options.Click: return to the values they had before the Undo Reset button (or menu item) was selected, if the Undo Reset button is enabled.

title: Sidebar Menu: Restrict Graph to Viewport Checkbox

options.Check: always be contained within the viewport.
options.Uncheck: be allowed to extend past the viewport

options.Keep as Detected: Upon loading or reloading the GRNsight webpage, the viewport size should be automatically detected and set to small, medium, or large, based on the size of the browser window.
options.Select \"Small\": The viewport size should be set to small
options.Select \"Medium\": The viewport size should be set to medium
options.Select \"Large\": The viewport size should be set to large
options.Select \"Fit to Window\": The viewport size should automatically be set to the size of the browser window

options.Select \"Format edges based on optimized: format edges based on optimized weight parameters
options.Select \"Default to black edges with reg: default to black edges with regular arrowheads

options.Select \"Show With Mouse Over\": A single edge weight should display when user mouses over a single edge.
options.Select \"Always Show Edge Weights\": All edge weights should always be visible.
options.Select \"Never Show Edge Weights\": No edge weights should be visible.

title: Dropdown Menu: Edge -> Hide/Show Edge Weights

options.Check \"Show With Mouse Over\": A single edge weight should display when user mouses over a single edge.
options.Check \"Always Show Edge Weights\": All edge weights should always be visible.
options.Check \"Never Show Edge Weights\": No edge weights should be visible.

title: Sidebar Menu: Edge Weight Normalization Factor

options.Enter a Number in the Box and Click \"Se: reload with the new normalization factor applied to its edge weight thicknesses

title: Dropdown Menu: Edge -> Edge Weight Normalization Factor

options.Enter a Number in the Box and Press Ente: reload with the new normalization factor applied to its edge weight thicknesses

options.Click: reset to its default normalization factor and reload the graph

title: Dropdown Menu: Edge -> Reset Edge Weight Normalization

options.Click: reset to its default normalization factor and reload the graph

options.Change the Grey Threshold Value: edges that fall below the threshold value colored gray

title: Dropdown Menu: Edge -> Gray Threshold Input Box

options.Change the Grey Threshold Value and Pres: edges that fall below the threshold value colored gray

title: Sidebar Menu: Show Grey Edges as Dashed Checkbox

options.Uncheck: show gray lines as solid lines
options.Check: show gray lines as dashed lines

title: Dropdown Menu: Edge -> Show Grey Edges as Dashed

options.Uncheck: show gray lines as solid lines
options.Check: show gray lines as dashed lines

title: Viewport Menu: D-Pad Control

options.Click Center Button: move to the center of the bounding box (note that it is not the same thing as the viewport

conditional: if "Restrict Graph to Viewport" is Unchecked.

title: Sidebar Menu: Top Dataset
text: The top half of each node should be colored using data from

options.Keep Default Selection: the first expression dataset detected in the input workbook

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Dropdown Menu: Node -> Select Top Dataset
text: The top half of each node should be colored using data from

options.Keep Default Selection: the first expression dataset detected in the input workbook

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Sidebar Menu: Bottom Dataset
text: The bottom half of each node should be colored using data from

options.Keep Default Selection: the same dataset as the top dataset

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Dropdown Menu: Node -> Select Bottom Dataset
text: The bottom half of each node should be colored using data from

options.Keep Default Selection: the same dataset as the top dataset

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Sidebar Menu: Log Fold Change Max Value
text: The node coloring visualization's color intensity should

options.Keep Default Value: default to having a Log Fold Change Max Value of 3

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Dropdown Menu: Node -> Log Fold Change Max Value
text: The node coloring visualization's color intensity should

options.Keep Default Value: default to having a Log Fold Change Max Value of 3

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Sidebar Menu: Average Replicates Values (Top Dataset)

options.Check: average replicate values for top dataset
options.Uncheck: not average replicate values for top dataset

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Dropdown Menu: Node -> Average Replicates Values (Top Dataset)

options.Check: average replicate values for top dataset
options.Uncheck: not average replicate values for top dataset

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Sidebar Menu: Average Replicates Values (Bottom Dataset)

options.Check: average replicate values for bottom dataset
options.Uncheck: not average replicate values for bottom dataset

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Dropdown Menu: Node -> Average Replicates Values (Bottom Dataset)

options.Check: average replicate values for bottom dataset
options.Uncheck: not average replicate values for bottom dataset

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Sidebar Menu: Node Coloring Toggle Button

options.Click: Node coloring should toggle between on and off, with default being on and button text should toggle between 'Enable Node Coloring' and 'Disable Node Coloring'

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

title: Dropdown Menu: Node -> Disable Node Coloring

options.Check: Node coloring should become disabled, and Node Coloring Toggle Button text in sidebar menu should read 'Enable Node Coloring'
options.Uncheck: Node coloring should become enabled, and Node Coloring Toggle Button text in sidebar menu should read 'Disable Node Coloring'

conditional: if expression data sheets are present in input workbook

options.Keep as Detected: Upon loading or reloading the GRNsight webpage, the viewport size should be automatically detected and set to small, medium, or large, based on the size of the browser window.
options.Check \"Small\": The viewport size should be set to small
options.Check \"Medium\": The viewport size should be set to medium
options.Check \"Large\": The viewport size should be set to large
options.Check \"Fit to Window\": The viewport size should automatically be set to the size of the browser window

title: Dropdown Menu: View -> Restrict Graph to Viewport

options.Check: always be contained within the viewport.
options.Uncheck: be allowed to extend past the viewport

options.Enter Zoom Value, then Press Enter: should zoom according to the value

options.Keep at Default: be in force graph layout by default

title: Dropdown Menu: Layout -> Lock Force Graph Parameters
text: The Force Graph Parameter sliders should

title: Dropdown Menu: Layout -> Reset Force Graph Parameters

options.Click \"Reset Force Graph Parameters\": revert to the default values, if Lock Force Graph Parameters is unchecked

options.Click \"Undo Reset\": return to the values they had before the Undo Reset button (or menu item) was selected, if Undo Reset is enabled.

options.Input Value, then Press Enter: The graph's edges should visibly change in length to the value entered if Lock Force Graph Parameters is unchecked
The graph's nodes should visibly change it's level of attraction to each other to the value entered if Lock Force Graph Parameters is unchecked

options.Right Click: Gene information page should appear in a new tab within the browser.

options.Select a species: Opening gene information pages will use information of the selected species.

options.Select a species from a dropdown list: Opening gene information pages will use information of the selected species.
